hints.content:
The bottom bar lines up to $\purpleD{18}$.   


[[☃ image 1]]

Which type of nut are there $\purpleD{18}$ of in the can?

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number in a can and the vertical axis labeled Nut type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, and 27. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: question mark, question mark, question mark, and question mark. The bar line for each type of nut shows the following: first question mark bar line labeled 18 extends to 18, second question mark bar line extends to 24, third question mark bar line extends to 21, and fourth question mark bar line extends to 15.  A purple line is drawn up from 18, which reaches to the end of the first question mark bar line labeled 18. !

hints.content:
Kind of nut | Number in the can 
:- | :-: 
Cashews | $\purpleD{18}$ 

The can has $\purpleD{18}$ cashews.  So, the bottom bar should be labeled $\purpleD{\text{Cashews}}$.

Now let's label the other bars.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number in a can and the vertical axis labeled Nut type. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, and 27. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: Cashews, Almonds, Pecans, and Walnuts. The bar line for each kind of nut shows the following: Cashews bar line extends to 18, Almonds bar line extends to 24, Pecans bar line extends to 21, and Walnuts bar line extends to 15. !

question.content:
Jack created a chart and a bar graph to show how many of each type of nut were in his can of mixed nuts.


Kind of nut | Number in the can 
:- | :-: 
Pecans| $21$ 
Almonds | $24$ 
Cashews | $18$ 
Walnuts| $15$ 

**Label each bar on the bar graph.**

[[☃ label-image 1]]
